title: Western style font - similar to Korinna ?
content:
I can't seem to find this one anywhere. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225002859im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kenyon2_5752.jpg)
author: coop1964

comments.content:
Did you check Letterhead Fonts? I think they have something similar.

- Mike Yanega

I think it may also resemble Rick Mueller's [Stowaway](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225002859/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/mueller/r_z.htm), but I can't see enough letters at TypOasis. It may also be at Dafont.This is a revival of an old Art Nouveau-era design, I think.

- Mike Yanega

Scriptorium's [Blackthorn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225002859/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/blackthorn/) is quite similar, but not identical. David Nalle's description of its influences mentions circus and old west styles, as well as Art Nouveau and Alfonse Mucha, so who knows what other fonts may have had similar inspirations.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks for your help Mike. Looks like I'll have to modify ITC Benguiat or something. I was trying to save the customer artwork charges.

Thanks again!
